args: A stag! And a large one.\nHe'd fill the Halidom's larder nicely.
What do you think, Sarisse? Can you take\nhim down with the manacaster from here?
(Deep breath... Focus.\nSteady arm... Take aim, and...)
Huh? I hadn't even pulled the trigger!
That looked like...an arrow?\nWho shot it?
What are you two doing in these woods?
Oh! Are...you the one who shot that deer?
I am. A pair of fellow hunters, I take it?\nOdd choice of weapon for a sylvan, though.
Ah! So you noticed. Here's the thing...
Huh. Thought you'd take the manacaster\nyou got off that human for a whirl and add\nto your meat stores in one fell swoop, eh?
That was the idea. But I'm so sorry—\nI didn't realize these were your village's\nhunting grounds.
Bah, it's fine. I trust our kind to hunt\nresponsibly. But that caster's gotta go.
It's made of steel, for one. You have any\nidea how many mountains humans have\ntorn apart to mine the ore for those things?
Twists my guts to see a sylvan heftin' one\naround. Have you no respect for the land\nyou stand on, girl?
What?! Of course I do! It's true that\nhumans may have harmed the earth to\nmass-produce these in the distant past...
But my friends would never do that. They\ndidn't make this manacaster; they just dug\nit up and repaired it.
Even so, that doesn't change the fact that\nMother Nature paid the price for the birth\nof that weapon.
I...suppose it doesn't. But I'm sincere\nwhen I say that I am very seriously\ncommitted to ecological conservation.
At the same time, I swore I'd fight to\nprotect my friends, my family, and the\npeople of my village.
You talk of fighting. Fitting enough you\ncarry an implement of war, then.
Unlike the bow, that thing doesn't require\na lick of training. It's all too eager to steal\nlives for you. An evil invention...
Evil? Surely a tool should be judged\nby the person who wields it.
One pull of the trigger and a life is snuffed\nout. I'd say that's proof enough of the\nevil in the hearts of humans.
Sir, that isn't fair! I agree that it was wrong\nto level mountains to mine the steel, but\nthat's no basis for calling all humans evil!
...You're still young. I'm sure the humans\nwho've sweet-talked you did a fine job of\nit, but I'd ask you to think long and hard.
It'll be dark soon. You two are welcome to\nstay the night in our village. You're family.
*sigh* Seems like there's still a big\ndivide between sylvans and humankind.
I'm afraid so. He's hardly the only sylvan\nI've met with closed-minded views about\nother races.
And I get it. That's how they were raised.\nHow they've lived their whole lives. Still!
Manacasters are a perfectly respectable\npart of human culture, no different from\nour preservation of nature.
I hate it when people dig in their heels\nand refuse to consider other perspectives.
And I just know that if they'd reach across\nthat divide and actually get to know the\nother side, they'd change their minds!
I hope so, Sarisse... Now, it's getting late.\nLet's get some sleep. It's back to bow\nhunting tomorrow, right?
Right. We have to respect these people's\nrules while we're here. Good night, Melsa.
Mnnngh...AHHH! I slept well!\nReady to hit the hunting trail?
Yep! I'd like to thank the man from\nyesterday for his hospitali... Huh?
That's a big crowd.\nI wonder what's up.
Maybe something happened.\nLet's go take a look!
Sorry to butt in, but is everything all right?
Hm? Oh, it's you girls. A bear came\nthrough last night and tore up our fields.
Aye. The forest here's bountiful, but it\ncan't compete with the village food stores.
We see bears, boars, deer... All sorts of\nanimals come to eat our crops.
That must be difficult... Plus there's the\ndanger of a villager being attacked.
It's a real problem. Which is why we cull\nany animals who make a habit of raiding\nthe village.
Much as we hate to harm a part of\nnature, it has to be done.
I see. So you've already taken care of\nthat bear?
No... We couldn't finish it off before it ran.\nIt's a big one, to boot.
Won't it be back, then? Bears are\nnotoriously persistent when it comes\nto food.
Aye. That's why we're setting out to hunt it\nbefore that happens.
I thought I told you plain that we don't\nwant anyone shooting a manacaster\nin our woods.
I understand that. I brought my bow as\nwell. Please, let me help you.
Hm... If you're using a bow, I've no cause\nto turn you down. Follow me and stay alert.
There it is, mister! Looks like it didn't\nwander far.
Waiting for a chance to sneak back into\nthe village, the cheeky devil... All right.\nThis time, we'll—
Yeah, just... That bear's awfully high-\nstrung. It's got freakishly good hearing,\ntoo.
Hm? True... We were barely whispering,\nbut it heard us from that distance.
Bears do have sharp ears, but that one's\non a whole different—wait a second.
Get this, Melsa: I just thought of a way to\nget rid of that bear without having to kill it!
Now, to put this genius plan into action!
Sar—ack! Sarisse, where are you going?!
Hurry! We've gotta beat it back to the\nvillage!
